descr.p: This unit provides TMarkdownWriter, a concrete implementation of TFormattingWriter that generates Markdown output.

The writer supports document structure (headers, paragraphs), text formatting (bold, italic, underline via HTML), tables with proper alignment, lists (unordered, ordered, definition), preformatted code blocks, and character escaping for special Markdown characters.

element.name: TMarkdownWriter
element.short: Markdown output writer with native Markdown formatting

descr.p: TMarkdownWriter generates standard Markdown output from formatted content.

Headers use # symbols (number matches level + 1), bold text uses ** delimiters, italic text uses * delimiters, and underline uses HTML <u> tags. Tables use pipe (|) separators with automatic header row underlining, lists use dash (-) bullets, and code blocks use triple backticks (```).
Special characters are escaped to prevent structural conflicts with Markdown syntax.

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.Create
element.short: Creates a new Markdown writer instance

descr.p: Creates a new TMarkdownWriter instance that writes to the specified stream.
The constructor initializes table and list tracking state for proper formatting.

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.Create.AStream
element.short: Output stream for the generated Markdown

descr.p: Escapes characters that could break Markdown structure.
EscapeText escapes backslashes (\), square brackets ([]), but preserves formatting characters (* _ ` #) as they might be intentional formatting.

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.EscapeText.Result
element.short: Text with escaped Markdown special characters

descr.p: Begins document generation and writes the document title as level 1 header if provided.
The title is formatted with a single # symbol and followed by blank lines.
Completes document generation.
Markdown does not require explicit document ending markers.
Starts a header section at the specified level using # symbols.
The number of # symbols equals the level + 1.
Completes the header section and adds blank lines for separation.
Starts a new paragraph.
Markdown paragraphs do not require explicit start markers.
Completes the current paragraph and adds blank lines for separation.

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.LineBreak
element.short: Forces line break with trailing spaces

descr.p: Forces a line break by writing two trailing spaces.
This creates a hard line break in Markdown output.
Writes a horizontal rule using three dashes (---) with blank lines for separation.

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.BoldStart
element.short: Begins bold formatting with double asterisks

descr.p: Begins bold text formatting by writing double asterisks (**).

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.BoldEnd
element.short: Ends bold formatting with double asterisks

descr.p: Ends bold text formatting by writing double asterisks (**).

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.ItalicStart
element.short: Begins italic formatting with single asterisk

descr.p: Begins italic text formatting by writing a single asterisk (*).

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.ItalicEnd
element.short: Ends italic formatting with single asterisk

descr.p: Ends italic text formatting by writing a single asterisk (*).

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.UnderlineStart
element.short: Begins underline formatting with HTML tag

descr.p: Begins underline text formatting by writing HTML <u> tag.
Markdown has no native underline support, so HTML tags are used.

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.UnderlineEnd
element.short: Ends underline formatting with HTML tag

descr.p: Ends underline text formatting by writing HTML </u> tag.
Begins a preformatted code block using triple backticks (```).
Code blocks preserve whitespace and disable Markdown formatting.
Ends the preformatted code block with closing triple backticks (```).

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.TableStart
element.short: Begins Markdown table with pipe separators

descr.p: Begins a Markdown table with the specified number of columns.
Table cells are separated with pipe symbols (|) and header rows are automatically underlined.

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.TableStart.NoCols
element.short: Number of columns in the table

descr.p: Completes the table and adds a blank line for separation.
Begins a new table row by writing the initial pipe symbol (|).

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.RowEnd
element.short: Completes table row with separator line

descr.p: Completes the current table row.
For header rows, automatically adds a separator line with dashes (---) below.
Begins a table cell by adding a leading space for padding.

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.CellEnd
element.short: Completes table cell with pipe separator

descr.p: Completes the table cell by adding trailing space and pipe separator ( |).
Begins a table header cell.
Header cells are formatted identically to regular cells.
Completes the table header cell and triggers separator line creation.
Begins a list by adding a blank line for separation.
All list types use dash (-) bullets for consistency.
Completes the list and adds a blank line for separation.

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.ListItemStart
element.short: Begins list item with dash bullet

descr.p: Begins a list item using a dash (-) bullet for all list types.
Completes the current list item and moves to a new line.

element.name: TMarkdownWriter.DefinitionItem
element.short: Writes definition item with term and description

descr.p: Writes a definition item with the term name followed by a colon (:) and description.
